storyInfo: 'Fallen' Sanktas outside of Laterano begin to return to the city. Federico and Arturia escape the 'dream' and see a deeply anomalous Laterano.

attributes.content: Slow down! You got a death wish or something? We're carrying a damned Originium plate! We're all dead if you drop it!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker A

attributes.content: Seriously, what the hell is wrong with this family, using this as a pickling stone? Do they like their pickles with a touch of Originium?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker A

attributes.content: Shut your *Sarkaz expletive* mouth and keep moving.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker B

attributes.content: We gotta clear this whole district before the end of the day, unless you want the overseer to chew our heads off after the Lich chews his.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker B

attributes.content: So many houses, and we got to clean every single speck of Originium off 'em... doesn't Babel have a dedicated construction team? Why don't we just tear it all down and rebuild from scratch?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker A

attributes.content: Say, it's gonna take some getting used to, not having any Originium around.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker A

attributes.content: I said, shut your *Sarkaz expletive* mouth.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker B

attributes.content: We didn't have a choice but to rely on the mines. Now that Kazdel doesn't need to worry about energy anymore, of course we gotta clean house...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker B

attributes.content: Unless you LIKE living in a den of Originium—hey, watch where you're going, Lich!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker B

attributes.content: Keep your threads tucked away, Lich. Who knows what might happen if they got tied up in the Originium...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker A

attributes.content: That's not very polite.
You can cut the threads with your horns if they do get tied up. But who knows what dimension my thread will drag you into, if it comes to that?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Alright, I don't think I should scare you any further, gentlemen. Go ahead.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Did I imagine it? What's that light?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker A

attributes.content: It came from the house up there, maybe? Let's take a look.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker B

attributes.content: ...I'll go.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Wha?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker A

attributes.content: Those houses are right by the agricultural plate that has just been integrated. The light must be from one of the soil beacons, in reaction to the Originium plate that you're carrying.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: If Wiš'adel finds out the farmland that she's spent two years cultivating got polluted...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Alright. Let's get outta here.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Worker B

attributes.content: D-Don't come any closer!
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Ezell

attributes.content: Ermengarde looks at the agitated girl standing in front of her, trying to shield the man behind her with her tiny body.
It's a Sankta man, kneeling feebly on the ground. His halo and wings have shattered, their pieces still trembling and flickering, like dying fireflies.
The Sankta does not speak. It is as though he has fallen into a deep slumber.
Who are you? Are you here to take us away?
attributes.name: Cecelia

attributes.content: The girl is all tensed up. Ermengarde bends down and puts her hands on her knees, doing her best to show that she intends no harm, even wagging her energized tail friendly.
I mean no harm, young lady.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I sent the other Sarkaz away. Did you heard that? Maybe I can help you... help him.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Ermengarde closes the door behind her, shutting out any prying eyes.
She adjusts her hat. Invisible threads reach out through an unknowable dimension.
Master.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: All that red-tape and long-winded tomes in the spires made me sick, but I should thank the twin sheep for their hospitality, compared to what I have to deal with now.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Every policy has to be communicated verbally, and you have to explain things over and over again. When are we going to implement basic education for government employees?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: This is urgent.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: ...Go ahead.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I'm at the furnace node. I found two Sanktas with broken halos... one of them doesn't look right at all.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Bring them here. Try not to let anyone see you. We don't need a scene in the streets.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I'll go wake Wiš'adel. Looks like it's time for our Speaker to speak at an emergency meeting.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: ...The list is a long one.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You're saying that all forty-three Sanktas stationed at spires across Zwillingstürme have abandoned their posts without permission.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Yes, Ewigegnade.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: They have already left Leithanian soil, forcing their way through the checkpoint at the Erdenherre border.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Leithanien took in these errari as an act of kindness. Now they have chosen desertion... without any warning.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Not entirely.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The night watch of the Reichsmusikhochschule witnessed a Sankta scholar leaving, and noted that his halo and wings were shattered, as if there was a... serious accident.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: A Fallen?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The symptoms do not align exactly.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: How do you think this should be dealt with?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: A-Are you asking for my opinion?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Of course I am.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You are the mouth of the Austere Authority, Michael Wolfgang.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You are the only one who can speak with her voice in this realm, besides me.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You've grown in the past few years, both physically and mentally. Hildegard has taught you well.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I must commend you for making the report that you just did.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You have, in effect, admitted that you have access to certain... exceptional channels.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The Sanktas of Leithanien have fallen and deserted en masse. This is a serious matter... you are the only one capable of dealing with it, Ewigegnade.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I know that you, the Urtica boy, and even that Gräfchen are doing a few things under the surface. As a reward, I'm willing to turn a blind eye to that.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Now, back to the topic at hand.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The border guard reports that they seem to be headed for Laterano. It's likely that the Lateran Curia is involved.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Shall we send the Empresses' Voice to confront the Curia?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: One year ago, after Das Kaiserinnensfest, Yvangelista XI communicated to me that he wishes to work hand-in-hand with Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The anomalous circumstances with the Sanktas may indicate that the calamity the Pope had feared, so much that he would seek our help, has come at last.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Issue an edict, in the name of Eternal Grace and Austere Authority, to summon the best casters and scholars among all the spires.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Calamity will spare no corner of this great land. We must hasten our studies into the secret retrieved from the chaos.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Yes, Your Majesty.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I will arrange for it at once.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Perhaps not entirely at once.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Wh-What I mean is, I will instruct the Empresses' Voice to...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: The eventide is beautiful tonight, Michael. Stay and enjoy it with me.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The wound in the sky has healed. She would have appreciated this too... would she not?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Tsk...
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: ...East of the east of La Unidad, Laterano, holy city of white♪
attributes.name: Voice in the Tent

attributes.content: The guns there shoot fireworks, the targets all apples♪
attributes.name: Voice in the Tent

attributes.content: When we pray sincere, He gives us bread♪
attributes.name: Voice in the Tent

attributes.content: When we seek salvation, He sets us free♪
attributes.name: Voice in the Tent

attributes.content: Sing, sing until you're asleep.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: The god in your dreams is kinder than Laterano's.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You didn't need to go this far on the night watch, Aurela.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: ...Get lost.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: This is the Minoan border. Those Singas nobles won't go any further. You're safe.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: The abbey is no more. We go our separate ways.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Ten years ago, you came to my abbey and protected my plate from those nobles without a word. Now, you're leaving without a word.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: You preach your teachings, I protected the kids in exchange for a new roof over my head, that's all.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Don't think too much of yourself.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You can't leave, Aurela.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: I'm not asking.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Our destination is the same. We'll go with you to Laterano.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: And when did I say I was bringing you with me?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: We've been together for ten years. It's a long time for a K'uk'ulkan.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Maybe I don't trust Laterano that much. But I do trust you.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: The Lateran stripped you of citizenship, and you've cursed the city many times while I sang the hymns...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: But look at yourself. After all these years in Bolívar, you still won't take off the gun-knight's armor...
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Even though you've fallen, lost the ability to wield a patron firearm, you somehow got your hands on this Blacksteel gun, which means you never—
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Shut up.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: The fallen angel suddenly raises her gun, the muzzle almost reaching the K'uk'ulkan's lips.
If you trust me, you should remember that I've told you many times the Holy City is not so friendly, kind, or tolerant as you imagine...
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Half the people who followed you from the abbey are not Sankta.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: There are plenty of places you can go after leaving Bolívar.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Perhaps what we follow is not the true Lateran faith, but it's what kept a modicum of order in our lives amidst the chaos of Bolívar.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: There's no way I can convince the others to go somewhere else. They want to make the pilgrimage.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Nor can I convince myself. Laterano is part of us now, after these long years.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: You've got to be kidding.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Think of the Sanktas in the abbey. They've never known Laterano, only the trauma of the Fall.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Only by returning to Laterano will they know what happened. Only then will the fear be driven out. Only then can their 'sickness' be cured.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Let us walk together for a little while longer, Aurela.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: I'm not going back to Laterano because I miss home.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Ten years ago, an old man said something like this to me, at another abbey. He was the one who exiled me in the name of Laterano, because of some silly mistake.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: He wanted to hear me repent, hear me pray. He said there was a chance I could go back, if I truly, sincerely repented for my sins...
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You refused?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: I sure did.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Something seems to have gone really wrong in the Holy City. I'm going to seize this chance for revenge.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Nueda steps forward, and presses her face against the cold gun barrel.
We won't stop you.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: We just need a guide. Someone who knows the way.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Someone like you.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: The hymns begin to die down, replaced by the sound of children crying out.
Aurela lets out a laugh and puts away her gun.
The Shrine of Nurtury smears its colors on the surrounding buildings, opening numerous portals through which strange creatures with halos emerge one-by-one, falling to the ground.
Did those things get the blessing of Laterano too? It wasn't just the baby arborbeast?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: (Claps excitedly)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature A

attributes.content: (Sways uncertainly)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature B

attributes.content: They crawl on the ground, wagging their heads furiously, still trying to adjust to their halos. They bellow in a low, rhythmic voice, as if joining together in prayer.
Urgh. That's one ugly, chaotic voice of the heart.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: If everyone in the Holy City has fallen into a sort of mass hallucination of an unknown source...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Does this scene before us mean that the boundary between reality and falsehood is being blurred, and that Laterano is being invaded by a material threat?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: This is even more incomprehensible than what we experienced in the Pavillon.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: One of them has noticed us, Fede.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: (Praying)
attributes.name: Enlightened Creature A

attributes.content: The noise we made seems to have disrupted their ritual.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: An enlightened creature turns toward Federico and Arturia, perhaps because it missed part of the prayer.
Its halo flashes, and its bloated hide seems to grow light and lithe, approaching the duo at high speed.
Federico raises his gun, but the halo-adorned creature pays no heed, not even stopping its prayer.
Fall back. The nature of these creatures is yet unknown. We must not be surrounded.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I thought you would shoot without hesitation.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Are these creatures our kin, Fede? Are you in violation of the Law if you shoot?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Is that a joke, or simply an ill-timed curiosity?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Your patron firearm is lost, and I can neutralize these creatures without discharging mine.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We will determine whether they should be considered our kindred, but not now.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Perhaps there is someone who can answer our questions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Pope Yvangelista XI.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Move!
attributes.name: Federico
